docs.snippet: When a couple began dating, she thought he was an airline pilot and he was unaware she had a flourishing career as a singer.
docs.lead_paragraph: IN Los Angeles, as in other cities overflowing with driven single people, ''What do you do?'' is often asked before ''How do you do?'' And though many pressing questions about a new acquaintance can be easily answered (or so it seems) with a few taps on a smartphone, Savannah Auger and James Citron remained blissfully unaware of entire sections of each other's lives when they began dating. She thought he was an airline pilot, and she did not tell him that she had a flourishing second career as a singer -- and would be on the road for weeks at a time. Mr. Citron, now 34, said that when he first spotted Ms. Auger, across a crowded party, he gaped. The party had been given by their yoga teacher at a bar in the Venice neighborhood of Los Angeles where Mr. Citron lived. Ms. Auger was one of some 30 women there, but Mr. Citron (one of the very few men in attendance) zeroed in on her.

docs.snippet: When a couple began dating, she thought he was an airline pilot and he was unaware she had a flourishing career as a singer.
docs.lead_paragraph: When a couple began dating, she thought he was an airline pilot and he was unaware she had a flourishing career as a singer.

docs.snippet: The ousted leader, Fernando Lugo, said he would use resistance to the new establishment to regain power.
docs.lead_paragraph: The ousted leader, Fernando Lugo, said he would use resistance to the new establishment to regain power.
docs.abstract: Paraguay’s ousted president, Fernando Lugo, lashes out at the political establishment that removed him from office after a hastily arranged trial, saying he will forge a popular movement aimed at regaining power; move is a sharp reversal from his initial acceptance of his ouster, and ratchets up pressure on country’s new government, led by Federico Franco, named president by the Senate after Mr Lugo’s expedited impeachment trial.

headline.main: In Reversal, Ex-President of Paraguay Seeks Power
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, Ex-President Of Paraguay Seeks Power

docs.snippet: Pele has called the deftly chipped penalty kick known as the Panenka the work of "either a genius or a madman," and they have been tried by both over the years.
